TITLE.P: Acquisition of a dilution refrigerator to Center for Quantum Devices.

SHORT_DESCR.P: We intend to purchase a dilution refrigerator system which allows for electrical measurements of nano-scale devices at temperatures below 20mK and in high magnetic fields. Establishing and controlling such conditions are a prerequisite for experimental studies of quantum effects in electrical transport through nanostructured devices.

We intend to purchase a dilution refrigerator system which allows for electrical measurements of nano-scale devices at temperatures below 20mK and in high magnetic fields. Establishing and controlling such conditions are a prerequisite for experimental studies of quantum effects in electrical transport through nanostructured devices.

AC_QUALITY.AC_CRITERION: Art. 32, Paragraph 2, Point b — only 1 economic operator

D_JUSTIFICATION.P: A cryostat is required with a sample vacuum loading system where the experimental wiring is heat sunk in the fridge (and not on a static probe). Due to room-temperature decay of samples a fast initial cool-down (<10 minutes) to below 100Kelvin is essential. It is essential that the system is fully compatible with the sample pucks and loading mechanism of the Oxford Instrument Triton cryostats already installed in the laboratory. Since this is a niche marked there is only 1 supplier of a product meeting the above requirements.

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: A complaint against the contracting entity who, in accordance with the Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council, Article 32, has decided to award a contract without prior publication of a contract notice in the Official Journal of the European Union must, in accordance with the Danish act on enforcement of procurement rules, etc. § 7, para. 3, be filed to the Danish Public Procurement Appeal Board within 30 calendar days from the day following the day on which a contract notice is published in the Official Journal of the European Union.

The Danish act on enforcement of procurement rules, etc. defines in § 2, para. 2, point 1, a standstill period of 10 calendar days from the day after the date on which the voluntary ex ante transparency notice is published in the Official Journal of the European Union.

Latest at the same time as a complaint is lodged to the Danish Public Procurement Appeal Board, the appellant shall in writing inform the contracting entity about the lodging of a complaint to the Danish Public Procurement Appeal Board, and whether the complaint has been submitted in the standstill period. In cases where the complaint is not submitted in the standstill period, the appellant must specify any suspensive effect of the complaint according to The Danish act on enforcement of procurement rules § 12, Para. 1.
